title: Growth Through Conflict
description: Explore how conflicts contribute to your relationship growth

questions.text: Our conflicts have helped us understand each other better.

therapeutic.rationale: Conflict handled well increases understanding. When disagreements reveal what matters to each person, partners know each other more deeply afterward.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If conflicts haven't increased understanding, explore what's been learned. Sometimes the lessons are there but unacknowledged.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual sense that conflicts build understanding transforms disagreement into connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What have you learned about your partner through your conflicts?

questions.text: We've gotten better at handling disagreements over time.

therapeutic.rationale: Improving at conflict indicates learning and growth. Couples who get better at disagreeing build confidence that they can handle challenges together.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If improvement isn't felt, explore what would help. Sometimes progress has happened but isn't recognized; sometimes new skills are needed.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared perception of improvement creates confidence in your conflict skills.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How has your conflict style changed since you've been together?

questions.text: Some of our best conversations have come after working through something difficult.

therapeutic.rationale: Post-conflict conversations can be deeply connectingâ€”vulnerability has been shared, defenses are down, understanding is fresh. These moments can bring couples closer than they were before.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If post-conflict connection doesn't happen, explore what's getting in the way. Lingering hurt? Exhaustion? Sometimes explicit reconnection helps.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of connection after conflict creates positive association with repair.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Have conflicts ever led to closer connection afterward? What made that possible?

questions.text: I feel like I've grown as a person through navigating conflict with my partner.

therapeutic.rationale: Relationship conflict, when handled well, develops emotional intelligence, communication skills, and self-awareness. Growing through conflict is a gift relationships can offer.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If personal growth hasn't occurred, explore what would help. Sometimes we grow without noticing; sometimes the conflict patterns prevent growth.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual experience of personal growth through conflict enriches both individuals and the relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How have you grown through navigating conflict with your partner?

questions.text: Our relationship is stronger for having worked through difficult things together.

therapeutic.rationale: Relationships that survive challenges often emerge stronger. Knowing you can weather storms together builds confidence and trust in your partnership.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If the relationship doesn't feel stronger, explore what's preventing that. Unhealed wounds? Ongoing patterns? Understanding the gap helps address it.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of strength from challenges creates resilient partnership.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Has your relationship been strengthened by what you've worked through?
